db_fUser module¶

db_fUser.insert_user(name, password, rol)¶

Inserts user in table.

Parameters:
  • name (String) – Name of the user in application
  • password (String) – Password of the user in application
  • rol (Rol) – Work of the user
Returns:

User object, or None if IntegrityError
db_fUser.get_user(username)¶

Retrieves user object from database.

Parameters:username (String) – Username of the user to retrieve
Returns:User object, or None if DoesNotExist
db_fUser.get_all_registers(sort=False, value=None)¶

Obtains all the registers of the User table. Admits a sorting option.

Parameters:
  • sort (Boolean) – If True, will sort
  • value (String) – By which field will be the registers sorted (username, work)
Returns:

SelectQuery with the registers
db_fUser.get_username(user)¶

Returns the name of a user.

Parameters:user (User) – User object
Returns:String
db_fUser.get_work(username)¶

Returns the work of a user.

Parameters:username (String) – Username of the user
Returns:Rol object
db_fUser.get_tickets_created(user)¶

Obtains the tickets created by a user.

Parameters:user (User object) – User whose created tickets are to be retrieved
Returns:SelectQuery with the tickets created by the user
db_fUser.count_tickets_created(user)¶

Obtains the number of tickets created by a user.

Parameters:user (User object) – User whose created tickets are to be counted
Returns:Integer with the number of tickets created by the user
db_fUser.get_tickets_assigned(user)¶

Obtains the tickets assigned to a user.

Parameters:user (User object) – User whose assigned tickets are to be retrieved
Returns:SelectQuery with the tickets assigned to the user
db_fUser.count_tickets_assigned(user)¶

Obtains the number of tickets assigned to a user.

Parameters:user (User object) – User whose assigned tickets are to be counted
Returns:Integer with the number of tickets assigned to the user
db_fUser.check_password(username, password)¶

Checks if the parameteres are of a valid user.

Parameters:
  • username (String) – Username that is going to be checked
  • password (String) – Password that is going to be checked
Returns:

True if username and password match, False if it does not match and None if user does not exist
db_fUser.print_user(user)¶

Debug function. Prints user data (username, password, work, num. assigned tickets).

Parameters:user (User object) – User whose data will be printed
